snippet: Sunday was a crowning evening for Emily London-Jones and her only child, Ravens receiver Jacoby Jones, who grew up in New Orleans and scored two touchdowns in the Super Bowl.
abstract: Baltimore Ravens receiver Jacoby Jones, who grew up in New Orleans, makes glorious return to his hometown with two touchdowns in the Super Bowl and the longest kickoff for a touchdown ever made in a National Football League postseason game; Jones tells reporters that he was an underdog all his life and went into the game determined to become a hometown champion.
lead_paragraph: Sunday was a crowning evening for Emily London-Jones and her only child, Ravens receiver Jacoby Jones, who grew up in New Orleans and scored two touchdowns in the Super Bowl.

headline.seo: For Raven From New Orleans, a Glorious Return, Two Ways
headline.main: For Raven, a Glorious Return (to Hometown and End Zone)
headline.print_headline: For Raven, a Glorious Return (To Hometown and End Zone)
